Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Yelp \Yelp\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Yelped}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Yelping}.] [OE. yelpen, [yogh]elpen, to boast, boast noisily, AS. gielpan, gilpan, gylpan; akin to OHG. gelph arrogant: cf. Icel. gj[=a]lpa to yelp. Cf. {Yap}.] [1913 Webster] 1. To boast. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
I keep [care] not of armes for to yelpe. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
2. To utter a sharp, quick cry, as a hound; to bark shrilly with eagerness, pain, or fear; to yaup. [1913 Webster]
A little herd of England's timorous deer, Mazed with a yelping kennel of French curs? --Shak. [1913 Webster]
At the least flourish of a broomstick or ladle, he would fly to the door with a yelping precipitation. --W. Irving. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Yelp \Yelp\, n. A sharp, quick cry; a bark. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
yelp n : a sharp high-pitched cry (especially by a dog) [syn: {yelping}] v : bark in a high-pitched tone; "the puppies yelped" [syn: {yip}, {yap}]
